intro: Corydalis filiformis, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, creeping stems and clusters of small, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which range from pink to purple, bloom in early spring, adding a subtle yet striking touch to alpine gardens. Corydalis filiformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
